metadata.title: CVE-2013-0191 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
libpam-pgsql (aka pam_pgsql) 0.7 does not properly handle a NULL valuereturned by the password search query, which allows remote attackers tobypass authentication via a crafted password.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-pgsql - 0.7.3.1-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pam-pgsql package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.3.1-4').
